data.name: CrashResource.Text
data.value:
This J2ME Midp 2.0 Beat them up game developed by the French company DeValley Entertainment is the first collaboration project with Vivendi Universal Games Mobile.

Just like Holy Wars, this project was just about done when I first started working for DeValley. I was asked to contribute to this project during the last weeks of crunch time and put in a few all-nighters to finish the game on time. I worked mostly on HUD display and some dialogue engine debugging.

Reviews :

  • Pocket Gamer.co.uk Score:5/10
  • Midlet-Review Score
  • Mobile Game FAQs Score:85/100
  • IGN Score:6/10
  • Project-Next Score:78/100
Vivendi's Game commercial

data.name: HolyWarsResource.Text
data.value:
Holy Wars is J2ME Midp 2.0 Beat them up game developed by the French company DeValley Entertainment is one of DeValley's most successful recent titles.

This project was already developed after I started working at DeValley, but I was later put in charge of managing the porting and resolving a lot of device specific bugs.

Reviews :

  • Pocket Gamer.co.uk Score:6/10
  • Midlet-Review Score


Game Trailer
Trailer 2

data.name: LandersTextResource.Text
data.value:
Landers is J2ME Midp 2.0 Shoot Them Up game developed by the French company DeValley Entertainment is one of my favorite mobile games, sadly I only worked on this project to add a score crypting component, and program the php site to decrypt the score codes and rank the players of the game online.

The game features an amazing soundtrack for a cell phone game, fast paced action and addictive gameplay.

  • Pocket Gamer.co.uk Preview
  • Project Next Score : 90/100, Next Approved Award


Official Trailer :

data.name: MyHeroTextResource.Text
data.value:
My Hero: Astronaut is a soon to be released by Majesco in the US 3D space exploration game for Nintendo DS.The game has for now only been anounced and will be revealed at the upcoming E3.

I was main programmer on this project which required the building of a brand new game engine on top of the company's base library wrapper of the DS functions.

I will publish more info and links about this game once after the E3.




The game is the second one presented in this video :

data.name: NowhereTextResource.Text
data.value:
Nowhere is a J2ME Midp 2.0 Survival Horror Game developed by the French company DeValley Entertainment.

I was the lead programmer for the development of this project and also worked on some of the porting.

The really interesting feature about this project was its goal to create a very disturbing atmosphere, always trying to keep the player uneasy yet wanting to discover the rest of the game, just like the feelings that can be experienced when watching a classic horror movie.

I am especially proud of having worked on this game, but to present it a little more objectively, I will refer you to some of the reviews :
  • Pocket Gamer.co.uk Score : 7/10, Bronze Award
  • Midlet-Review Score : 9/10, Mobile Game Award
  • Mobile Game FAQs Score : 82/100, Silver Award
  • Project Next Score : 89/100, Next Approved Award
(Please e-mail me if you know of another English speaking review of this game - email address is on my Resume Page)

Furthermore, the game was nominated for two awards at the Festival du Jeu Vidéo 2007, best scenario and best mobile game.

If you are not yet convinced, you can view this Game Trailer, but if you are you can already buy this game!



Official Trailer

data.name: SpiderwickTextResource.Text
data.value:
The Spiderwick Chronicles is a J2ME Midp 2.0 Adventure Game developed by the French company DeValley Entertainment and published by Vivendi Universal Games Mobile.

I was the lead programmer for the development of this project.

This game was created in anticipation of the upcoming Paramount movie and was a licensed product designed to target the same audience that the movie and Tony DiTerlizzi and Holly Black's novels appeal to, such as younger audiences.

Vivendi Universal Games Mobile came to us with this project after we had finished Crash of the Titans, around August 2007 it seemed at the time like a good project to look into but one of the demands was very special: they would need the game to be developed in two months with one extra month of debugging, about half the time we usually spend on games. At that time the Paramount movie was expected to hit the theatres around January 2008.
The other developers were already deep into other projects so I was the only one relatively available putting the finishing touches on the game Nowhere, however I had just only finished my first game as a lead developer and that had taken me about 5 months with debugging. The added responsibility did not scare me and for some reason I really felt confident I could get the job done well and in time. Luckily for me I did!

This project succeeded because the two guys I worked with, brothers Simon and Etienne Perin really did a tremendous job as graphic artist and game designer respectively. The graphics are really top notch and are I believe by far the best feature of the game, and Etienne's work really made everything happen. His early game design documents were right on the money, and thanks to them I was able to schedule almost all the necessary coding tasks from the start of the project, we all put in a lot of extra hours early on and we were so conscious of the tight schedule that we actually ended the project a couple days early.

The game was also at times frustrating to make because a lot of the creative decisions were out of our hands, we often wanted to push the gameplay further and sometimes had to simplify some of our gameplay features. However with hindsight I see now that these decisions we good marketing decisions and that the game is well tailored for its target audience.
Spanner Spencer from Pocket Gamer wrote a review that best reflects the game :
  • Pocket Gamer.co.uk Score : 7/10, Bronze Award


Vivendi's Game commercial




Opening game of Vivendi's Game commercial: Hit Mobile Game Line-Up 2008 :

data.name: SpooksTextResource.Text
data.value:
Spooks the Mobile game is a J2ME Midp 2.0 Click and Play Game developed by Gameloft.

During this project I helped the Lead game designer with scripting while I also helped the two programmers debug the game before going gold.

This game follows the adventures of the famous british MI5 TV spies.
Keith Andrew's review on Pocket Gamer :
  • Pocket Gamer.co.uk Score : 7/10, Bronze Award



Gameplay video :
